question: Carmen needs $7 more to have twice the amount of money that Jethro has. Meanwhile, Patricia has $60, which is 3 times as much as Jethro. What is the sum of all their money?
solution:
Jethro has 60/3 = $<<60/3=20>>20.
Twice of what Jethro has is $20 x 2 = $40
Carmen has $40 - 7 = $<<40-7=33>>33
The sum of all their money is $60 + $20 + $33 = $<<60+20+33=113>>113
#### 113
clean_solution:
Jethro has 60/3 = $20.
Twice of what Jethro has is $20 x 2 = $40
Carmen has $40 - 7 = $33
perturbed_solution:
Jethro has 60/3 = $20.
Twice of what Jethro has is $20 x 2 = $40
Carmen has $40 - 7 = $89
completed_solution_clean:
Patricia has $60, which is 3 times Jethro’s amount, so Jethro has $60 ÷ 3 = $20.  
Twice Jethro’s money is $20 × 2 = $40.  
Carmen needs $7 more to have $40, so Carmen has $40 − $7 = $33.  
Total money = $20 + $60 + $33 = $113.  

#### 113
completed_solution_perturbed:

Twice what Jethro has is $20 × 2 = $40.  
Carmen has $40 − $7 = $33.  
The sum of all their money is $20 + $60 + $33 = $113.  

#### 113
